text: Ok - This is a weird issue I've been seeing in a personal project of mine and I'm hoping someone here is cleverer than me. I have a LAMP stack app. When I pull records from a table in that app, I have one field (a smallint) that shows one value in the db, but another when I write it to the screen. Value transformations I'm seeing are 3 -> 4, 4 -> 5, 9 -> 12. Any ideas?
strange. In my experience three is five and five is four and four is the magic number.
(sorry, I'll go be completely unhelpful somewhere else)

if it was 3->4, 4->5, 9->10 the column might be defined auto_increment? You could do a "show create table <table>" and look at how the column is defined? Not sure how 9->12 fits into that theory though :confused:
